Metadata: Choosing and buying residential property in the coastal zone

As the amount of developed coastline increases, the pool of remaining buildable waterfront land tends to diminish in quality. Prospective buyers should educate themselves about building on oceanfront property before making a purchase. This newsletter describes common concerns that affect coastal property in Oregon such as bluff erosion, beach erosion, and weather events. Also provided is a checklist to help assess traits of any particular parcel.
